Function Documentation

void RTC001_ClearFlagStatus ( RTC001_FlagType  Flag )

This function clears the respective RTC flag. The function can be called at any time to clear the flag status.

Parameters:
[in]FlagEnum value of type RTC001_FlagType whose flag status will be cleared
Returns:
void

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

  #include <DAVE3.h>
  int main(void)
  {
    // Initialize and RTC counter
    DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
    RTC001_Enable();
    while(!RTC001_GetFlagStatus(HOURS_FLAG))
    {
      // Hour event happened
      RTC001_ClearFlagStatus(HOURS_FLAG);
    }
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {}
  }

status_t RTC001_Clock_GetTime ( RTC001_TimeHandle *  timeptr )

This function gets the clock time at the particular instance and returns the status.

Parameters:
[in]timeptrPointer to structure in which time values are written
Returns:
status_t
DAVEApp_SUCCESS :if timer is deleted successfully
RTC001_ERROR : If failed

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
   RTC001_TimeHandle CurrentTime;
   // Initialize and RTC counter
   DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
   RTC001_Enable();
   while(!RTC001_GetFlagStatus(HOURS_FLAG))
   {
     // Read current time
     RTC001_Clock_GetTime(&CurrentTime);
   }
   // ... infinite loop ...
   while(1)
   {}
 }

References RTC001_TimeHandle::DaWe, RTC001_TimeHandle::Days, RTC001_TimeHandle::Hours, RTC001_TimeHandle::Min, RTC001_TimeHandle::Month, RTC001_ERROR, RTC001_FUNCTION_ENTRY, RTC001_FUNCTION_EXIT, RTC001_TimeHandle::Sec, and RTC001_TimeHandle::Year.

status_t RTC001_Clock_SetTime ( RTC001_TimeHandle *  timeptr )

This function sets the clock time and returns the status.

Parameters:
[in]timeptrPointer to structure which contains time values to be configured
Returns:
status_t
DAVEApp_SUCCESS : if timer is deleted successfully
RTC001_ERROR : If failed

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
   RTC001_TimeHandle SetTime;
   uint32_t Status;
   // Initialize and RTC counter
   DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
   RTC001_Disable();
   SetTime.Sec = 32;
   SetTime.Min = 30;
   SetTime.Hours = 4;
   SetTime.Days = 15;
   SetTime.Month = 5;
   SetTime.Year = 2012;
   Status = RTC001_Clock_SetTime(&SetTime);
   if(Status == DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
   {
     //Success
   }
   RTC001_Enable();
   // ... infinite loop ...
   while(1)
   {}
 }

References RTC001_TimeHandle::Days, RTC001_TimeHandle::Hours, RTC001_TimeHandle::Min, RTC001_TimeHandle::Month, RTC001_ERROR, RTC001_FUNCTION_ENTRY, RTC001_FUNCTION_EXIT, RTC001_INVALID_HANDLE, RTC001_TimeHandle::Sec, and RTC001_TimeHandle::Year.

status_t RTC001_ConfigAlarm ( const RTC001_HandleType *  Handle,
RTC001_TimeHandle *  timeptr,
AlarmCallBackPtr  CallBack,
uint32_t  CbArg 
)

This function configures the RTC001 Alarm. The user has to fill the alarm pointer before calling this function.

Parameters:
[in]HandleRTC app Handle
[in]timeptrPointer to structure which contains alarm time values
[in]CallBackAlarm event callback function name
[in]CbArgCallback function argument
Returns:
status_t
DAVEApp_SUCCESS : if timer is deleted successfully
RTC001_ERROR : If failed

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 static volatile bool AlarmEvent;
 void Alarm_CallBack(uint32_t Temp)
 {
   AlarmEvent = TRUE;
 }
 int main(void)
 {
   uint32_t Status;
   RTC001_TimeHandle Alarm_Time;
    // ... Initializes Apps configurations ...
   DAVE_Init();
   Alarm_Time.Sec = 32;
   Alarm_Time.Min = 30;
   Alarm_Time.Hours = 4;
   Alarm_Time.Days = 15;
   Alarm_Time.Month = 5;
   Alarm_Time.Year = 2012;
   Status = RTC001_ConfigAlarm(&RTC001_Handle,&Alarm_Time,Alarm_CallBack,0);
   if(Status == DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
   {
     //Alarm is created successfully
   }
   // ... infinite loop ...
   while(1)
   {}
 }

void RTC001_DeInit ( void   )

DeInitialization function which Deinitializes the App internal data structures to reset values. The values of the RTC registers are set to their default values.

Returns:
void

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

  #include <DAVE3.h>
  int main(void)
  {
    // Initialize and RTC counter
    DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
    RTC001_DeInit();
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {}
  }


Definition at line 249 of file RTC001.c.

References RTC001_FUNCTION_ENTRY, and RTC001_FUNCTION_EXIT.

status_t RTC001_Disable ( void   )

Disable function which disables the App. The Api is usually called to set time and set alarm. The access to timer registers and alarm registers are allowed only when RTC is disabled. There in that case this Api comes into function.

Returns:
status
DAVEApp_SUCCESS : for success
RTC001_ERROR : for failure case

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

  #include <DAVE3.h>
  int main(void)
  {
    // Initialize and RTC counter
    DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
    RTC001_Disable();
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {}
  }


Definition at line 286 of file RTC001.c.

References RTC001_ERROR, RTC001_FUNCTION_ENTRY, and RTC001_FUNCTION_EXIT.

status_t RTC001_Enable ( void   )

Enable function which enables the App. The RTC module is enabled by calling this function, it can be called by the user soon after configuring the time and alarm through UI.

Returns:
status
DAVEApp_SUCCESS : for success
RTC001_ERROR : for failure case

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

  #include <DAVE3.h>
  int main(void)
  {
    // Initialize and RTC counter
    DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
    RTC001_Enable();
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {}
  }

References RTC001_ERROR, RTC001_FUNCTION_ENTRY, and RTC001_FUNCTION_EXIT.

status_t RTC001_GetFlagStatus ( RTC001_FlagType  Flag )

This function gets the respective flag status. The user can call this function at any time to check the flag status.

Parameters:
[in]Flagenum value of type RTC001_FlagType whose flag status will be returned
Returns:
status
RTC001_SET : for success
RTC001_RESET : for failure case

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
   // Initialize and RTC counter
   DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
   RTC001_Enable();
   while(!RTC001_GetFlagStatus(HOURS_FLAG))
   {
     // Hour event happened
     RTC001_ClearFlagStatus(HOURS_FLAG);
   }
   // ... infinite loop ...
   while(1)
   {}
 }


Definition at line 324 of file RTC001.c.

References DAYS_FLAG, RTC001_FUNCTION_ENTRY, RTC001_FUNCTION_EXIT, RTC001_RESET, RTC001_SET, and YEARS_FLAG.

void RTC001_Init ( void   )

Initialization function which initializes the App internal data structures to default values. The UI configurations are taken care in this function. The user entered values are taken into account while initialization. The RTC001_Clock_SetTime Api and RTC001_ConfigAlarm Api are called within the RTC001_Init function.

Returns:
void

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

  #include <DAVE3.h>
  int main(void)
  {
    // Initialize and RTC counter
    DAVE_Init(); // RTC001_Init() will be called within DAVE_Init()
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {}
  }


Definition at line 239 of file RTC001.c.

status_t RTC001_Time ( time_t *  time )

This function returns the time in seconds from the epoc time(01/01/1970).

NOTE: The entered date should be after the Epoc date.

Parameters:
[in]timePointer to an object of type time_t, where the time value is stored.
Returns:
status_t
DAVEApp_SUCCESS : if time value is calculated successfully
RTC001_ERROR : If failed

Reentrant: NO

Example: 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
   status_t status = RTC001_ERROR;
   time_t Time_Sec;
   // ... Initializes Apps configurations ...
   DAVE_Init();
   status = RTC001_Time(&Time_Sec);
   if(status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
   {
           //error
   }
   RTC001_Disable();
   // ... infinite loop ...
   while(1)
   {}
 }
